poem:
**In the Eye of the Platter**

Fame, a silver fork,  
stabbing the heart of hunger.  
A menu made mute,  
where order flips to offer,  
and kitchens serve whispers  
of stories untold—  
fresh and braised,  
sautéed in shadows.  
Jesse, unstarred yet shining,  
digests compliments,  
leaves unvoiced the irony,  
just a man feeding,  
beneath the glow,  
full yet hollow.
